study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of vitamin D interventions on glycaemic control in subjects with type 2 diabetes (T2D).
results_summary: Vitamin D supplementation significantly reduced fasting blood glucose, HbA1c, HOMA-IR, and fasting insulin levels in T2D patients, with stronger effects observed in those with vitamin D deficiency, overweight status, or high baseline HbA1c. The benefits were dose- and duration-dependent.
population_specificity: Subjects with type 2 diabetes (T2D).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the relationship between multiple sclerosis (MS) and 25-hydroxyvitamin D serum levels, VDR gene polymorphisms, and vitamin D supplementation.
results_summary: The study found that the FokI VDR gene polymorphism was significantly associated with an 8% reduction in MS risk, but the overall evidence on vitamin D's role in MS remains inconclusive, requiring further research.
population_specificity: Individuals with multiple sclerosis (MS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of vitamin D supplementation on COVID-19-related outcomes, including mortality, hospital length of stay, and various biomarkers.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that vitamin D supplementation significantly reduced hospital length of stay, though evidence of its effectiveness was inconsistent for other outcomes.
population_specificity: COVID-19 patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of vitamin D-calcium supplementation in improving metabolic profiles for the treatment of gestational diabetes.
results_summary: Vitamin D-calcium supplementation significantly reduced fasting plasma glucose and improved metabolic profiles in pregnant women with gestational diabetes compared to the control group. The meta-analysis included five RCTs with consistent positive outcomes.
population_specificity: Pregnant women with gestational diabetes (306 participants across five studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the effects of vitamin D on cells of the central nervous system and explore its potential role in neuroprotection and myelin regeneration.
results_summary: The study highlights vitamin D's roles in maintaining neurological homeostasis, protecting brain function, and influencing neurons and glial cells, suggesting potential benefits for neurodegenerative disease prevention and treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (review of existing studies on central nervous system cells)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between vitamin D status and diabetes, including its preventive or therapeutic effects, and to understand the underlying mechanisms through which vitamin D influences diabetes.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D may influence diabetes risk, progression, and complications through mechanisms such as regulating insulin secretion or sensitivity, modulating β-cell function, and exerting immunomodulatory and anti-inflammatory effects. Human studies suggest potential benefits of vitamin D supplementation in diabetes prevention or therapy.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human population, with focus on pancreatic β-cells, hepatocytes, and immune cells).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of vitamin D in nanotechnology-based drug delivery systems, focusing on its synthesis, metabolism, signaling, and therapeutic applications.
results_summary: The study highlights that vitamin D, when encapsulated in organic nanocarriers, enhances bioavailability and therapeutic effects, including potential anticancer properties and synergistic effects with other agents. It also discusses advancements in nanocarrier design for improved drug delivery.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the risks of high-dose vitamin D supplementation, genetic susceptibility to toxicity, and potential treatments for vitamin D intoxication.
results_summary: The study found that unsupervised high-dose vitamin D supplementation poses a risk of severe toxicity, particularly hypercalcemia, with inter-individual variability linked to genetic factors. It also reviewed pharmacological interventions, including corticosteroids and steroid-sparing alternatives, for treating vitamin D intoxication.
population_specificity: General population, with a focus on vitamin D-replete individuals and those with genetic predispositions (e.g., CYP24A1 polymorphism).
effective_dosage: Not specified (high-dose mentioned but not quantified).
interactions: Systemic glucocorticoids, 1α-hydroxylase inhibitors (keto/fluconazole), and CYP3A4 inducers (rifampicin) were noted as potential treatments.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically assess the effectiveness of vitamin D supplementation in alleviating chronic pruritus across diverse clinical contexts.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that vitamin D supplementation significantly reduced pruritus severity, skin lesion area, and levels of inflammatory cytokines (TNF, IL-6, hs-CRP) compared to controls. These results suggest vitamin D could be a promising therapeutic option for chronic pruritus, though further studies are needed to validate findings and clarify mechanisms.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic pruritus (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of plant-based milk consumption, including its effect on serum vitamin D concentrations, in children and adolescents.
results_summary: Observational studies found that plant-based milk consumption was associated with lower serum vitamin D concentrations compared to cow milk. One clinical trial noted that fortified soy milk improved bone density in adolescent girls with low calcium intake.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents aged 1-18 years.

study_goal: The researchers were examining the limitations of current treatments for heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF) and the potential impact of emerging therapies, not specifically Vitamin D.
results_summary: The abstract does not mention any findings related to Vitamin D.
population_specificity: Patients with heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of vitamin D on managing acute exacerbations and symptoms in people with COPD.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D had little to no effect on the rate of moderate or severe exacerbations, lung function changes, serious adverse events, mortality, or quality of life in COPD patients.
population_specificity: Adults with a clinical diagnosis of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
study_duration: Ranged from six weeks to 40 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of Vitamin D supplementation in preventing hypoparathyroidism and hypocalcemia after thyroid surgery.
results_summary: The study highlights the importance of Vitamin D supplementation as part of preoperative and postoperative management to prevent hypoparathyroidism and hypocalcemia, with parathyroid hormone levels being a key predictor of outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing thyroid surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between hormonal contraceptive use and vitamin D levels, assessing whether contraceptive types influence vitamin D deficiency prevalence.
results_summary: Combined oral contraceptive (COC) users had significantly higher mean serum vitamin D levels (31.90 ng/ml) compared to Norplant (24.08 ng/ml), DMPA (24.83 ng/ml), and non-users (22.00 ng/ml). COC use reduced the odds of vitamin D deficiency by 90%, while higher education, lack of fish consumption, and no vitamin D supplementation increased deficiency risk.
population_specificity: 162 women using hormonal contraceptives (Norplant, DMPA, COC) and 162 age- and BMI-matched non-users in Gondar town, Ethiopia.
study_duration: Data collected from February to April 2023 (cross-sectional, no intervention duration specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the role of electrolyte interactions, including divalent cations, in host-pathogen dynamics and immune defense mechanisms.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that divalent cation levels (e.g., calcium and magnesium) influence host susceptibility to pathogens and immune responses, but it does not directly address Vitamin D's effects.
population_specificity: Persons with immune deficiencies, diabetes mellitus, or renal disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify distinct metabolic phenotypes in critically ill patients and assess the differential effects of high-dose vitamin D supplementation among these phenotypes.
results_summary: The study identified four distinct metabolic phenotypes, with one (cluster D) showing significant increases in branched-chain amino acid catabolic metabolites, long-chain acylcarnitines, and diacylglycerol species following high-dose vitamin D supplementation. The results suggest differential metabolic responses to vitamin D based on phenotype.
population_specificity: Critically ill adults

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate bone health management, including Vitamin D supplementation, in adult patients with inflammatory idiopathic myopathies (IIM) in the UK and Hong Kong.
results_summary: The study found that Vitamin D/calcium supplements were used by 95% of UK patients and 52% of HK patients, but compliance with bone health guidelines was poor overall. Osteoporosis and osteopenia prevalence varied between regions, with higher treatment thresholds exceeded in Hong Kong.
population_specificity: Adult patients with inflammatory idiopathic myopathies (IIM) in the UK (n=20) and Hong Kong (n=31).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether vitamin D supplementation improves insulin resistance in adults with prediabetes and identify potential mechanisms and specific populations that benefit.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D likely improves insulin resistance in prediabetes, with effectiveness varying by ethnicity and baseline vitamin D levels. It also suggested potential benefits in reducing type 2 diabetes incidence via mechanisms like increased serum osteocalcin levels.
population_specificity: Adults with prediabetes

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent findings on vitamin D's role in critically ill patients, focusing on its association with mortality, morbidity, and potential benefits of acute treatment.
results_summary: Vitamin D deficiency is common in critically ill patients and linked to higher risks of mortality, sepsis, acute respiratory failure, and prolonged ICU stays. While acute treatment with a loading dose shows promise, its full benefit remains unclear due to limited and heterogeneous trial data.
population_specificity: Critically ill patients (children and adults) in ICU settings.
effective_dosage: Loading dose in addition to ongoing maintenance therapy (specific amounts not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of vitamin D on muscle mass and physical/muscle function in middle-aged and older adults, focusing on its potential role in sarcopenia prevention and management.
results_summary: The study found inconsistent relationships between vitamin D and sarcopenia-related indices, with mixed results on muscle mass and strength. While animal studies suggest benefits, human studies did not show clear advantages of maintaining vitamin D levels for muscle health.
population_specificity: Middle-aged and older adults

study_goal: The researchers aimed to clarify the measurement of vitamin D, evaluate the scientific evidence on supplementation efficacy/safety, and discuss recommended deficiency/toxicity levels in light of standardization projects.
results_summary: The abstract highlights advancements in vitamin D measurement and standardization but does not present specific efficacy results. It emphasizes the need for further discussion on deficiency, insufficiency, and toxicity levels, as well as the interrelations between vitamin D, PTH, and FGF23.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore factors associated with health-related quality of life in kidney replacement therapy patients, including the influence of vitamin D levels.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D levels were among the influential factors affecting health-related quality of life, but no specific efficacy outcomes for vitamin D supplementation were reported.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing kidney replacement therapy (hemodialysis, peritoneal dialysis, or other forms) at a single hospital in Spain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if rapid normalization of vitamin D status improves health-related quality of life and reduces multiple organ dysfunction in critically ill children.
results_summary: The study established the efficacy and safety of a weight-based cholecalciferol loading dose to rapidly restore vitamin D levels in critically ill children, though broader clinical outcomes are still under evaluation.
population_specificity: Critically ill children aged newborn (>37 weeks corrected gestational age) to <18 years with blood total 25-hydroxyvitamin D <50 nmol/L.
effective_dosage: Single enteral dose of cholecalciferol (10,000 IU/kg, max 400,000 IU) at enrollment.
study_duration: Single dose administered at enrollment, with follow-up at 28 days, hospital discharge, and 90 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining testosterone therapy, progressive resistance training, and oral supplements (including vitamin D) improved physical performance in older hypogonadal men with mobility issues.
results_summary: The study found that the combination of testosterone supplementation and progressive resistance training improved physical performance (measured by the 30-s chair stand test), but the abstract does not isolate the specific effects of vitamin D supplementation.
population_specificity: Men aged ≥70 years with low testosterone levels and mobility problems.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize and critically evaluate preclinical evidence on the role of vitamin D in cardiovascular health, focusing on its potential preventive and therapeutic effects in cardiovascular diseases.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D modulates vascular tone, prevents fibrosis and hypertrophy, and influences key signaling pathways related to inflammation, oxidative stress, and pathological remodeling. Vitamin D supplementation demonstrated protective effects in cardiovascular disease models, reducing inflammation, attenuating hypertrophy, decreasing plaque formation, and improving cardiac function.
population_specificity: Preclinical models (in vitro cardiomyocyte cell lines and in vivo animal models, including knockout mice, diet-induced deficiency models, and disease-specific models like hypertension, hypertrophy, and myocardial infarction).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether maternal vitamin D-3 supplementation during pregnancy and lactation could reduce biomarkers of environmental enteric dysfunction (EED), systemic inflammation, and improve growth in women living with HIV and their infants.
results_summary: Vitamin D-3 supplementation reduced certain EED and systemic inflammation biomarkers in mothers but did not show significant effects on infants, except for a reduction in insulin-like growth factor 1 at 6 weeks of age.
population_specificity: Women living with HIV in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, and their infants.
study_duration: From the second trimester of pregnancy until 1 year postpartum

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore novel ALPL variants and other genes potentially contributing to hypophosphatasia (HPP) symptoms, including a variant in the vitamin D receptor (VDR) gene.
results_summary: The study identified a heterozygous variant of uncertain significance in the VDR gene in one patient, but no conclusive link to HPP or vitamin D effects was established.
population_specificity: 16 patients clinically diagnosed with HPP and low ALP activity, previously negative for ALPL variants.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine changes in free vitamin D and metabolites following high-dose bolus supplementation.
results_summary: The study found that high-dose bolus cholecalciferol supplementation was associated with falls and fractures, unrelated to hypercalcaemia. It examined changes in free vitamin D and metabolites post-supplementation.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.
effective_dosage: Three different oral bolus doses (specific amounts not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of omega-3 fatty acids from fish oil combined with gamma-linolenic acid from blackcurrant seed oil in children with atopic dermatitis.
results_summary: The abstract mentions mixed results from previous studies on omega-3 FA for AD, but does not provide specific findings from this study regarding Vitamin D.
population_specificity: Children with atopic dermatitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize the role of vitamin D in cancer prevention, carcinogenesis, and treatment, including its mechanisms of action and potential therapeutic applications.
results_summary: The study highlights vitamin D's immunomodulatory and metabolic effects, its association with reduced cancer risk (e.g., colorectal, breast, ovarian, prostate, pancreatic), and its involvement in cell proliferation, differentiation, and death. The exact role in cancer treatment remains under investigation and varies by cancer type.
population_specificity: Adults worldwide (general population, with emphasis on vitamin D deficiency prevalence).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether education on dietary intakes and specific food processing methods could improve serum calcium and PTH regulation in hemodialysis patients, indirectly assessing the role of Vitamin D analog therapy.
results_summary: The intervention group showed better-regulated serum calcium levels and stable PTH levels compared to the control group, suggesting improved management of secondary hyperparathyroidism. The study did not directly measure Vitamin D's effects but implied its role in the observed outcomes.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients with chronic kidney disease-associated mineral bone disorder (CKD-MBD).
effective_dosage: Not specified (individualized phosphate binder therapy and Vitamin D analog therapy were used, but dosages were not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the relationship between serum vitamin D, testosterone, and oxidative stress levels in women with female sexual dysfunction (FSD) and assess the effects of vitamin D supplementation.
results_summary: Vitamin D supplementation significantly increased serum testosterone levels and improved Female Sexual Function Index (FSFI) scores. It also positively correlated with antioxidant markers and negatively correlated with oxidative stress markers.
population_specificity: 40 women with FSD, aged 18-45 years.
effective_dosage: 300,000 IU intramuscularly initially, followed by 50,000 IU orally once a week for four weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether high-dose vitamin D3 supplementation improves bone recovery in patients with thyrotoxicosis caused by Graves' disease.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D3 supplementation did not improve bone mineral density or microarchitecture compared to placebo, though standard treatment for thyrotoxicosis led to significant bone recovery. Changes in bone turnover markers, but not thyroid hormones, were associated with improvements in bone health.
population_specificity: Newly diagnosed Graves' disease patients (86% female, average age 41 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the potential relationship between micronutrient levels, including Vitamin D, and nocturnal hypertension patterns.
results_summary: The study found no notable difference in Vitamin D levels between dipper and non-dipper hypertension groups, suggesting no significant association in this context.
population_specificity: Limited sample size from a single hospital, elderly population with hypertension.

study_goal: The researchers examined the interplay between frailty and epilepsy in older adults, including the role of low vitamin D as a risk factor for frailty.
results_summary: The study identified low vitamin D as one of several risk factors predisposing people with epilepsy to frailty but did not evaluate its direct effects or efficacy.
population_specificity: Older adults with epilepsy (PWE)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the safety and efficacy of neridronate in children with CRPS I who did not respond to previous treatments, including Vitamin D supplementation in one case.
results_summary: The study found that neridronate was effective in improving pain, physical function, and reducing the need for pain medications in most children with CRPS I. Vitamin D was mentioned as part of previous failed treatments in one patient, but its specific effects were not evaluated.
population_specificity: Children (mean age 10.4 years, range 7-13 years) with CRPS I who did not respond to prior therapies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of intralesional vitamin D versus triamcinolone for keloid treatment and correlate vitamin D receptor (VDR) expression with treatment outcomes.
results_summary: Vitamin D showed significant efficacy in reducing keloid severity (50% achieved a 50% VSS reduction) but was less effective than triamcinolone (76.7%). Vitamin D had fewer adverse effects (hypopigmentation and atrophy) compared to triamcinolone.
population_specificity: 60 patients with keloids, randomly assigned to vitamin D or triamcinolone treatment groups.
effective_dosage: Four intralesional injections at 4-week intervals (exact dosage not specified).
study_duration: 16 weeks (4 injections over 4-week intervals) with an 8-week follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of vitamin D levels and supplementation on the incidence of graft-versus-host disease (GvHD) in hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT) patients.
results_summary: The study found widespread vitamin D deficiency among HSCT patients, with mixed results on its association with acute GvHD but a significant link to chronic GvHD. Supplementation improved vitamin D levels in some studies, but the relationship with GvHD outcomes was inconsistent.
population_specificity: Patients undergoing hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the prevalence of vitamin D deficiency and associated risk factors in children and adolescents at a tertiary hospital in Abu Dhabi.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D deficiency is prevalent in children seeking medical care in the UAE, particularly among girls, older children, and adolescents, with higher rates observed during summer and autumn. No specific efficacy outcomes related to supplementation or treatment were reported.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients under 18 years of age attending an outpatient clinic in Abu Dhabi.
study_duration: Retrospective data collected from 1 January 2020 to 31 December 2021 (no intervention duration specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine whether vitamin D deficiency and insufficiency are causes of urinary tract infections (UTIs) and to explore the association between them in women and children.
results_summary: The study suggests that low serum vitamin D levels increase the risk of UTIs, particularly in children and women, and may contribute to recurrent infections. It also discusses potential immune system improvements with better vitamin D status but notes the relationship remains controversial.
population_specificity: Women and children, with a focus on those prone to UTIs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether vitamin D2 could prevent COVID-19 infection and improve symptoms post-infection.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in COVID-19 infection rates or symptoms between the vitamin D2 and non-intervention groups, though adequate vitamin D levels showed a modest tendency to prevent infection. Vitamin D2 significantly increased serum 25(OH)D levels but did not affect inflammatory markers.
population_specificity: 228 healthcare workers who initially tested negative for COVID-19.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of vitamin D supplementation on mortality in COVID-19 patients through a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The meta-analysis showed a significant reduction in all-cause mortality with vitamin D supplementation (pooled OR 0.72, 95% CI 0.53-0.98), particularly in severe cases. The findings suggest potential benefits of vitamin D as an adjunct treatment for COVID-19.
population_specificity: Adults with COVID-19.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically assess the association between vitamin D levels and COVID-19 infection risk and severity in children and adolescents.
results_summary: Vitamin D deficiency was prevalent among pediatric COVID-19 patients and was linked to increased infection risk, disease progression, higher inflammatory markers, reduced lymphocyte counts, and more severe symptoms like fever and cough. Maintaining adequate vitamin D levels may help reduce COVID-19 severity and complications in this population.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents with COVID-19 (1,071 participants across six countries).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether vitamin D deficiency is associated with arterial stiffness, aortic calcification, and lower bone mineral density in patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD).
results_summary: The study found no association between baseline 25(OH)D levels and markers of vascular function (pulse wave velocity, augmentation index, aortic calcification) or bone mineral density in CKD patients. Vitamin D deficiency was more common in patients with diabetes and cardiovascular disease but did not correlate with the studied outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with CKD stages 3b and 4.

study_goal: The researchers explored the potential immunomodulatory role of vitamin D in understanding anaemia's pathophysiology, alongside biomarker-based molecular techniques.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that vitamin D's immunomodulatory role, combined with molecular techniques, offers promising insights into anaemia's pathophysiology, but no specific results on vitamin D's effects are provided.
population_specificity: Not specified (general mention of vulnerable groups like children and expectant mothers).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the unresolved questions about vitamin D supplementation in chronic kidney disease (CKD) and renal transplant recipients, focusing on its non-skeletal benefits.
results_summary: The study highlights the link between hypovitaminosis D and mineral/bone metabolism disturbances in CKD, but robust evidence supporting vitamin D supplementation for non-skeletal purposes remains lacking. Guidelines recommend monitoring 25-hydroxyvitamin D levels, though conclusive recommendations for supplementation are absent.
population_specificity: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) patients and renal transplant recipients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the clinical and prognostic relevance of calcifediol (Vitamin D) treatment in hospitalized COVID-19 pneumonia patients, particularly its differential effects compared to glucocorticoids.
results_summary: The study found that calcifediol treatment significantly improved prognosis, reducing ICU admission and death, especially in patients receiving it without glucocorticoids (OR: 15.2 vs. glucocorticoids alone, p<0.001). Class 3 (60% calcifediol-only) showed better outcomes compared to other treatment groups.
population_specificity: Hospitalized COVID-19 pneumonia patients (aged 18-90) with confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection and CURB-65 >1.

study_goal: The researchers examined treatment strategies for secondary hyperparathyroidism (SHPT) in CKD patients, including the role of vitamin D receptor activators.
results_summary: Vitamin D receptor activators were identified as a first-line treatment for SHPT in CKD, though the abstract does not detail specific efficacy outcomes for vitamin D alone. PTX and thermal ablation were noted as more effective than medical treatment alone in reducing cardiovascular risk and mortality.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD) and secondary hyperparathyroidism (SHPT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the interaction between vitamin D deficiency and the well-being of postmenopausal women, focusing on musculoskeletal and cardiovascular implications.
results_summary: Clinical studies highlight the importance of maintaining optimal vitamin D levels to reduce musculoskeletal disorders and cardiovascular diseases in postmenopausal women, though conflicting findings suggest the need for further research on supplementation effectiveness.
population_specificity: Postmenopausal women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the role of Vitamin D in rare genetic diseases like X-linked hypophosphatemic rickets (XLH), hypophosphatasia (HPP), and osteogenesis imperfecta (OI), focusing on its deficiency and systemic effects.
results_summary: The study highlights that in XLH, excessive FGF23 reduces 1,25(OH)2D production, leading to poor enamel mineralization and dental anomalies. No direct efficacy or safety outcomes of Vitamin D supplementation were discussed.
population_specificity: Patients with rare genetic diseases (XLH, HPP, OI), particularly pediatric cases with dental manifestations.

study_goal: The researchers were comparing the efficacy and safety of tapinarof and roflumilast as novel topical treatments for psoriasis, not specifically evaluating Vitamin D.
results_summary: The abstract does not report findings specific to Vitamin D, focusing instead on tapinarof and roflumilast.
population_specificity: Patients with mild-to-moderate plaque psoriasis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of a single oral dose of 200,000 IU of vitamin D on hospitalized COVID-19 patients.
results_summary: The study found no significant support for the use of a single high dose of vitamin D in improving outcomes for COVID-19 patients. The abstract does not detail specific positive or negative effects, only concluding against its use.
population_specificity: Hospitalized COVID-19 patients in Sao Paulo, Brazil, with a mean age of 55.3 years and BMI of 32.2 kg/m².
study_duration: Single dose administration (duration not specified beyond this).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the scientific support for Vitamin D in managing depression, including epidemiological evidence, mechanistic explanations, and interventional studies.
results_summary: The study found that Vitamin D deficiency is associated with depression, and correcting this deficiency may provide clinical benefit. Interventional studies suggest potential efficacy, though the abstract does not detail specific outcomes.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of depression management).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of Vitamin D deficiency in the pathogenetic mechanisms of Lupus Nephritis (LN).
results_summary: The abstract mentions new insights into the role of Vitamin D deficiency in LN pathogenesis but does not provide specific results regarding its effects.
population_specificity: Patients with Lupus Nephritis (LN), a complication of Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare bone turnover suppression between patients with atypical femoral fractures (AFFs) and osteoporotic hip fractures (TFFs), focusing on factors like bisphosphonate use and bone turnover markers.
results_summary: The study included 336 females (113 with AFFs, 213 with TFFs) and analyzed demographic, clinical, and biochemical data, but did not report specific findings related to Vitamin D's effects.
population_specificity: Females aged ≥60 years who underwent operative treatment for AFFs or TFFs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of dietary supplements, including Vitamin D, on metabolic function markers in individuals with insulin-dependent diabetes (IDDM).
results_summary: The meta-analysis found a positive effect of Vitamin D on fasting C-peptide (FCP), but the evidence was of very low quality. Most studies showed bias concerns or high risk of bias, and the positive result is preliminary, requiring further investigation.
population_specificity: Individuals with insulin-dependent diabetes (IDDM)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between vitamin D, the gut microbiome, and their combined role in colorectal cancer prevention.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that vitamin D and the gut microbiome may influence colon carcinogenesis through mechanisms like inflammation and metabolic dysfunction, but specific outcomes or effects are not detailed.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if vitamin D supplementation reduced recurrence rates of BPPV in older adults compared to placebo.
results_summary: The study found an 87% reduction in BPPV recurrence rates in the vitamin D-treated group, with significantly longer time to first recurrence compared to placebo. No significant difference was observed between the treatment group and the vitamin D-replete control group.
population_specificity: Older adults with vitamin D deficiency and BPPV.
effective_dosage: 2000 IU daily for 13 weeks, followed by 1000 IU daily for the next 13 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of traditional versus cluster-set resistance training on vitamin D levels and other bone-related markers in older subjects with chronic kidney disease.
results_summary: The study found that cluster-set resistance training (RT-CS) resulted in more responsive subjects for vitamin D levels compared to traditional RT, as indicated by minimum clinically important difference (MCID) values. Both RT and RT-CS groups showed improvements in bone mineral density, but vitamin D-specific outcomes were more favorable in the RT-CS group.
population_specificity: Older subjects (mean age 57.55 ± 4.06 years) with chronic kidney disease undergoing maintenance hemodialysis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether weekly vitamin D supplementation could reduce the number of acute respiratory infections (ARI) in preschool children.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D supplementation increased serum 25(OH)D levels dose-dependently but did not reduce the number of ARI, hospitalizations, or affect LL-37/cathelicidin levels. No significant differences in adverse events were observed between groups.
population_specificity: Preschool children aged 1.5-3.5 years from three Chilean cities at different latitudes.
effective_dosage: 5600 IU/week (low-dose) or 11,200 IU/week (high-dose) of cholecalciferol (vitamin D3).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether vitamin D insufficiency is associated with increased mortality risk in individuals with osteoarthritis.
results_summary: Vitamin D insufficiency was correlated with higher all-cause mortality, CVD-related deaths, and other deaths, but not with cancer-related deaths. The hazard ratios indicated a modest but statistically significant increase in mortality risk.
population_specificity: 49,082 individuals with osteoarthritis (average age 60.69 years, 58.7% female) from the UK Biobank.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the most effective route (oral tablet, oral sachet, or intramuscular injection) for achieving optimal vitamin D levels (≥30 ng/mL) to support bone and mineral health.
results_summary: The monthly intramuscular injection group consistently achieved the highest mean vitamin D levels at both 6 and 12 weeks, with 100% of participants reaching sufficiency by 12 weeks. The study concluded that the intramuscular route was superior to oral tablets and sachets in achieving vitamin D sufficiency.
population_specificity: 132 participants aged 18-60 with initial serum vitamin D levels below 30 ng/mL.
effective_dosage: Daily 800 I.U. oral tablet (Group A), weekly 60,000 I.U. oral sachet (Group B), and monthly 300,000 I.U. intramuscular injection (Group C).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate associations between preconception vitamin D levels and biomarkers in couples seeking infertility treatment, focusing on live birth, pregnancy loss, and semen quality.
results_summary: Females with sufficient vitamin D status had a 28% higher likelihood of live birth compared to deficient females, with similar positive associations observed in males with normal BMI. No associations were found between vitamin D status and pregnancy loss or semen quality.
population_specificity: Couples seeking infertility treatment at four US centers.
study_duration: Couples were observed for 9 months or through pregnancy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of Vitamin D in the nonoperative treatment of atypical femoral fractures (AFFs) as part of osteoporosis management.
results_summary: The study suggests that optimizing Vitamin D levels, along with calcium, is part of the nonoperative treatment for AFFs, though its direct impact on fracture healing is not explicitly detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with atypical femoral fractures, particularly those with prolonged antiresorptive medication use.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of vitamin D deficiency and genetic thrombophilic risk factors on the management and outcomes of patients with thrombosed lower extremity venous aneurysms.
results_summary: The study found vitamin D deficiency in all patients, suggesting a potential association with thrombosed venous aneurysms, but did not establish a direct causal relationship or measure the efficacy of vitamin D supplementation. Surgical interventions were successful, but the role of vitamin D in outcomes was not explicitly analyzed.
population_specificity: Ten patients (5 males, 5 females; mean age 46.6 years) with thrombosed lower limb venous aneurysms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide a historical overview of psycho-neuro-endocrine immunology, including the role of Vitamin D hormone, within the context of rheumatic diseases.
results_summary: The abstract does not report specific findings about Vitamin D's effects; it focuses on summarizing historical literature in the field.
population_specificity: Not specified (historical literature review).

study_goal: The researchers explored the roles of FGF23 in regulating vitamin D metabolism and its potential as a biomarker for cardiovascular and chronic kidney diseases.
results_summary: FGF23, secreted by osteocytes, regulates vitamin D and phosphate metabolism and serves as an important biomarker for chronic kidney disease and cardiovascular diseases. The study suggests FGFs, including FGF23, hold therapeutic and diagnostic potential for metabolic and cardiovascular disorders.
population_specificity: Not specified (focus on animal models and early-stage clinical trials).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of topical roflumilast 0.3% cream versus a vehicle for treating plaque psoriasis, not specifically Vitamin D.
results_summary: Topical roflumilast 0.3% significantly outperformed the vehicle in achieving IGA/body-IGA success, PASI-50/75/90, and intertriginous-IGA success by week 8, with consistent results at weeks 2, 4, and 6. No significant difference was found in treatment-related adverse events or serious adverse events between groups.
population_specificity: 1,403 patients with plaque psoriasis (885 treated with roflumilast, 518 with vehicle).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the musculoskeletal effects of gender-affirming hormonal therapy (GAHT) and surgery (GAS) in transgender individuals, including the role of vitamin D in promoting bone health.
results_summary: The study highlights that ensuring adequate vitamin D, along with calcium and weight-bearing activity, promotes musculoskeletal health in transgender individuals. However, specific efficacy data on vitamin D supplementation alone were not detailed.
population_specificity: Transgender adolescents and adults undergoing GAHT or GAS.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize adrenocortical secretion in patients with postsurgical hypoparathyroidism on stable vitamin D and calcium treatment and assess the effects of continuous subcutaneous PTH (1-34) infusion.
results_summary: Hypoparathyroid patients showed reduced tissue aldosterone and cortisone levels compared to healthy controls, with no difference in tissue cortisol but a higher cortisol-to-cortisone ratio. PTH (1-34) therapy increased tissue levels of aldosterone, cortisol, and cortisone and reduced the cortisol-to-cortisone ratio.
population_specificity: 10 patients with postsurgical hypoparathyroidism, 10 with primary hyperparathyroidism, and 10 healthy volunteers matched for sex and age.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify core biomarkers, including Vitamin D, that could help evaluate the multisystemic impact of PCOS and inform clinical management.
results_summary: The study identified 25-hydroxy-vitamin D as one of 22 core biomarkers that were abnormal in women with PCOS compared to healthy controls, suggesting its potential role in assessing PCOS-related metabolic and endocrine dysregulation.
population_specificity: Women with polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS) compared to healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the prevalence of vitamin D deficiency, insufficiency, and bone-related complications in children requiring prolonged continuous kidney replacement therapy (CKRT).
results_summary: The study found high rates of vitamin D deficiency (17.2%) and insufficiency (69.0%) among children on prolonged CKRT, with 29.7% showing osteopenia and/or fractures. Chronic liver disease was associated with a higher risk of bone complications.
population_specificity: Children requiring CKRT for ≥28 days with regional citrate anticoagulation (n=37).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the optimal methods of vitamin D supplementation for preventing acute respiratory infections (ARIs).
results_summary: The study found no significant preventive effects of vitamin D supplementation against ARIs overall, but suggested a slight preventive effect when taken daily at doses between 400 and 1200 IU/d during spring, autumn, or winter.
population_specificity: 49,320 participants across 43 randomized-controlled trials.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the potential role of Vitamin D in the prevention and therapy of uterine fibroids.
results_summary: The study highlights the biological potential of Vitamin D as a promising alternative in the management and prevention of uterine fibroids, though further randomized studies are recommended.
population_specificity: Females with uterine fibroids (specific demographics not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of daily versus fortnightly oral vitamin D supplementation in children with symptomatic vitamin D deficiency.
results_summary: Both daily and fortnightly vitamin D regimens significantly increased calcium and phosphate levels while reducing alkaline phosphatase and parathyroid hormone levels, with no difference between groups. All children achieved sufficient 25(OH)D levels, though transient hypercalcemia and hypercalciuria were observed in some cases.
population_specificity: Eighty children with symptomatic vitamin D deficiency (40 in each treatment group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to consolidate existing literature on the association between vitamin D and uterine fibroid presence and growth.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that oral vitamin D supplementation significantly reduced fibroid size (standardized mean difference -5.7%). The study highlights vitamin D's potential in mitigating fibroid development and growth but calls for further research on dosage and treatment duration.
population_specificity: Premenopausal participants (n = 5650 in observational studies, n = 328 in RCTs).

study_goal: The researchers examined the role of plant-based diets in chronic kidney disease (CKD) prevention and management, including the impact of vitamin D deficiency in vegetarian diets.
results_summary: One study found vegetarian diets were associated with severe vitamin D deficiency compared to nonvegetarian diets. The abstract suggests incorporating vitamin D-rich foods in plant-based diets may be beneficial.
population_specificity: Individuals with or at risk of chronic kidney disease (CKD), including vegetarians.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of higher-than-normal and intermittent Vitamin D dosing regimens in high-risk populations for achieving and maintaining optimal 25(OH)D concentrations.
results_summary: The study found that daily doses of 7000 IU, weekly doses of 30,000 IU (or twice weekly), and weekly doses of 50,000 IU were effective in maintaining 25(OH)D levels ≥30 ng/mL in high-risk patients. These regimens were deemed safe and responsive to patient preferences.
population_specificity: Adults with obesity, liver disease, malabsorption syndromes, or multi-diseased patients (mainly seniors on multi-drug treatments affecting Vitamin D metabolism).
effective_dosage: 7000 IU/day, 30,000 IU/week or twice weekly, 50,000 IU/week.
study_duration: Prophylactic/maintenance doses for prolonged periods; 6-8 weeks for treatment without 25(OH)D assessment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess baseline engagement with vitamin D supplementation (≥5000 IU/day) as part of a multimodal lifestyle intervention and its association with health outcomes in people with multiple sclerosis.
results_summary: At baseline, 29.8% of participants engaged in vitamin D supplementation. Engagement with multiple healthy behaviours, including vitamin D, was associated with better health outcomes, but the study did not isolate vitamin D's specific efficacy.
population_specificity: People with multiple sclerosis (n=857)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether 1 or 2 years of alendronate could maintain bone density gains achieved with 1 year of denosumab, with calcium and vitamin D as a comparator.
results_summary: The study found that both 1 and 2 years of alendronate effectively maintained bone mineral density (BMD) gains from denosumab, with no rebound in bone turnover markers above baseline. Calcium and vitamin D alone also maintained BMD but showed transient decreases at certain sites and higher bone turnover marker increases compared to alendronate.
population_specificity: Postmenopausal osteoporotic women aged 60-79 at high fracture risk.
effective_dosage: Calcium and vitamin D alone (specific dosage not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential correlation between serum vitamin D levels and the risk of coronary artery lesions (CAL) in Kawasaki Disease (KD).
results_summary: KD patients generally had lower serum vitamin D levels compared to healthy controls, but findings on the association with coronary artery lesions and IVIG resistance were mixed, with some studies showing lower vitamin D linked to CAL, others showing higher levels, and some finding no significant difference.
population_specificity: 442 KD patients and 594 healthy controls.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of vitamin D and other micronutrients in alleviating symptoms of fibromyalgia, particularly in physical function and stiffness.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D deficiency appears to play a role in fibromyalgia symptoms, mainly affecting physical function and stiffness. The literature review supported these findings but noted limited studies on the topic.
population_specificity: Italian female patients with fibromyalgia (n=20).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the molecular mechanisms by which Vitamin D modulates innate and adaptive immunity under human in vivo conditions.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding Vitamin D's effects, only stating the study design and participant supplementation.
population_specificity: 25 healthy individuals
effective_dosage: Single vitamin D dose (specific amount not provided)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the correlation between serum Vitamin D levels in mothers and newborns with respiratory distress (RD) and assess the impact of Vitamin D treatment on clinical outcomes.
results_summary: The study found a significant association between Vitamin D levels and the risk of RD, RDS, and TTN in infants. Maternal Vitamin D supplementation (50,000 units) reduced neonatal RD likelihood by 64%, and infant supplementation showed clinical benefits.
population_specificity: Mothers and newborns, particularly those at risk for or diagnosed with respiratory distress (RD), respiratory distress syndrome (RDS), or transient tachypnea of the newborn (TTN).
effective_dosage: 50,000 units administered to mothers prior to childbirth.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether vitamin D supplementation during pregnancy, alone or combined with calcium or other micronutrients, safely improves maternal and neonatal health outcomes.
results_summary: The study found very uncertain evidence for most outcomes (e.g., pre-eclampsia, gestational diabetes, preterm birth) but suggested vitamin D may reduce severe postpartum hemorrhage and low birthweight, though confidence intervals were wide. Combined vitamin D and calcium showed no clear benefits, and evidence quality was low or very low.
population_specificity: Pregnant women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of high-dose vitamin D supplementation in reducing fatigue and neuropsychiatric symptoms in patients with post-COVID syndrome.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in fatigue, anxiety, and cognitive symptoms in the vitamin D group compared to placebo, with no significant differences in sleep quality, depression, or inflammatory markers. Adverse events were comparable between groups, and no serious adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: 80 patients with post-COVID fatigue or neuropsychiatric symptoms.

study_goal: The researchers examined whether Vitamin D supplementation could improve symptoms of restless legs syndrome (RLS).
results_summary: Vitamin D supplementation did not show significant benefits in managing RLS symptoms or improving sleep quality. The study found no notable positive effects compared to other supplements tested.
population_specificity: 482 participants across 10 randomized clinical trials, focusing on individuals with RLS.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the mechanistic role of Vitamin D in modulating gut microbiome composition and intestinal barrier function, as well as its therapeutic potential in managing intestinal diseases.
results_summary: The study found that Vitamin D deficiency alters gut microbiome composition, compromises intestinal mucosal barrier integrity, and is linked to intestinal pathologies like inflammatory bowel disease. Vitamin D regulates immune responses via VDR binding, influencing cytokine production and barrier function.
population_specificity: Patients with intestinal diseases (e.g., inflammatory bowel disease, irritable bowel syndrome, celiac disease) and general gut health.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify novel indicators, including vitamin D deficiency, that contribute to the complexity and severity of coronary artery disease (CAD).
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D deficiency was among the new indicators predicting CAD severity, alongside inflammatory parameters, microbiota alteration, and obstructive sleep apnea. However, the abstract does not specify the magnitude or statistical significance of vitamin D's effect.
population_specificity: Patients with coronary artery disease (CAD), including those with chronic coronary syndromes (CCS) and acute coronary syndromes (ACS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify potential non-invasive diagnostic biomarkers, including vitamin D binding proteins, for endometriosis and explore their therapeutic applications.
results_summary: Vitamin D binding proteins were identified as significantly differentially expressed in both serum and urine samples of women with endometriosis, suggesting a potential role in the disease's pathophysiology. The study did not directly assess the efficacy of vitamin D supplementation but highlighted its binding proteins as biomarkers.
population_specificity: Women with endometriosis (total participants: 2,486 across 26 studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the relationship between serum uric acid levels and bone parameters, including vitamin D, in postmenopausal women.
results_summary: The study found no significant effect of uric acid levels on vitamin D, but higher uric acid levels were associated with improved bone density and fewer vertebral fractures.
population_specificity: 679 postmenopausal women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether weekly high-dose vitamin D supplementation improves bone health in children living with HIV in sub-Saharan Africa.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results, as data analysis is ongoing. The study is the largest trial to date on vitamin D supplementation in children with HIV, focusing on bone health and long-term fracture prevention.
population_specificity: Children living with HIV in sub-Saharan Africa, particularly those with growth failure, stunting, and delayed puberty.
effective_dosage: Weekly high-dose vitamin D (exact dosage not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Vitamin D supplementation could reduce asthma exacerbation frequency and improve pulmonary function in asthma patients.
results_summary: Vitamin D supplementation reduced asthma exacerbations, including those requiring systemic corticosteroids or emergency/hospital visits, and improved lung function (FEV1% predicted value) and serum 25-hydroxyVitamin D levels.
population_specificity: Asthma patients (649 in experimental group, 646 in control group).

study_goal: The abstract does not specifically address Vitamin D but focuses on hypophosphatemia and its effects on mineralized tissue.
results_summary: The abstract discusses the causes and consequences of hypophosphatemia but does not mention Vitamin D or its effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of hypophosphatemia).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the relationship between vitamin D and allergic diseases, focusing on its immune-regulating role and the impact of supplementation on treatment outcomes.
results_summary: The study summarized current research linking vitamin D to allergic diseases like atopic dermatitis, allergic rhinitis, and asthma, suggesting it may influence disease onset and progression. It also discussed vitamin D's immune-modulating effects and potential benefits of supplementation in managing these conditions.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on allergic diseases)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Vitamin D supplementation improves signs and symptoms of dry eye disease (DED) in patients.
results_summary: Vitamin D supplementation significantly improved tear production, tear film stability, and reduced lid hyperemia and ocular surface disease index (OSDI), effectively alleviating DED symptoms. The results were statistically significant and clinically meaningful.
population_specificity: Patients with dry eye disease (DED).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of Vitamin D as an adjunct to steroids in managing Vitamin D-deficient oral lichen planus (OLP) patients and its inhibitory effect on IFN-γ.
results_summary: The study found that Vitamin D supplementation alongside steroids led to significantly greater pain relief, lesion resolution, and reduction in clinical severity compared to steroids alone. It also significantly reduced salivary and tissue IFN-γ levels, suggesting an anti-inflammatory effect.
population_specificity: 40 patients with ulcerative or erythematous OLP and Vitamin D deficiency or insufficiency (≤ 30 ng/ml).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the effects of vitamin D supplementation on metabolic parameters in women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) and vitamin D deficiency or insufficiency.
results_summary: Vitamin D supplementation significantly improved metabolic parameters, including BMI, WHR, insulin resistance, and lipid profiles, particularly in women with obesity or insulin resistance, but showed no significant effects in non-obese or non-insulin-resistant women.
population_specificity: Women with PCOS and vitamin D deficiency or insufficiency.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the role of vitamin D in neurological health, its impact on neurodegenerative diseases, and the potential benefits of supplementation.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D influences neural development, dopaminergic regulation, and growth factor synthesis, with deficiency linked to neurological disorders. However, intervention studies showed mixed results, emphasizing the need for further research.
population_specificity: Not specified (general neurological health focus)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the role of Vitamin D supplementation in managing complications like deficiency and reduced bone mineral density in patients with erythropoietic protoporphyrias.
results_summary: The study found that Vitamin D deficiency is a complication in erythropoietic protoporphyrias and recommended supplementation to address this issue, along with considering DEXA scans in adults.
population_specificity: Patients with erythropoietic protoporphyrias (EPP1, XLEPP, EPP2).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate correlations between SIBO subtypes (H+, M+, H+/M+) and nutritional status, including serum vitamin D levels.
results_summary: The H+/M+ SIBO subtype was associated with low serum vitamin D levels, but the study did not establish causation or evaluate vitamin D supplementation effects.
population_specificity: 67 newly diagnosed SIBO patients.

study_goal: The researchers evaluated the use of teriparatide (TPD) in treating pregnancy and lactation-associated osteoporosis (PLO), with historical focus on calcium and vitamin D as part of traditional treatment strategies.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results regarding Vitamin D's effects, focusing instead on TPD's outcomes in PLO treatment, such as increased bone mineral density and reduced fracture rates.
population_specificity: Women with pregnancy and lactation-associated osteoporosis (PLO), primarily primiparas.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of active vitamin D analogs and calcimimetic agents on parathyroid hormone, serum calcium, phosphorus, and bone turnover biomarkers in hemodialysis patients with secondary hyperparathyroidism.
results_summary: The study found that active vitamin D analogs (calcitriol and paricalcitol) increased serum calcium levels, while calcimimetic agents (cinacalcet, etelcalcetide, and evocalcet) reduced them. Calcimimetics were superior in reducing calcium-phosphorus product but had higher rates of gastrointestinal disorders compared to vitamin D analogs.
population_specificity: Hemodialysis patients with secondary hyperparathyroidism.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of non-pharmacological treatments, including Vitamin D supplementation, in slowing Parkinson's disease progression and preventing complications.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that adequate Vitamin D supplementation, alongside other non-pharmacological treatments like exercise and a calcium-rich diet, may help slow disease progression in Parkinson's patients. However, specific efficacy data or outcomes related to Vitamin D alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Patients with Parkinson's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of Vitamin D deficiency as an environmental factor in thyroid autoimmunization, particularly in Hashimoto's thyroiditis.
results_summary: The study suggests that Vitamin D deficiency, among other environmental factors, contributes to thyroid autoimmunization by influencing immune cell interactions and cytokine imbalances, but it does not provide specific efficacy data on Vitamin D supplementation.
population_specificity: Individuals with genetic predispositions and environmental risk factors for thyroid autoimmunity, particularly Hashimoto's thyroiditis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the associations between vitamin D and systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), including its immunomodulatory mechanisms and potential therapeutic effects.
results_summary: The study suggests vitamin D may help reduce corticosteroid dosage and attenuate SLE severity by regulating immune responses, though the exact mechanisms and efficacy remain incompletely understood.
population_specificity: Patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of redox imbalance on polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) patients and evaluate the benefits of vitamin D supplementation.
results_summary: Vitamin D effectively reduced malondialdehyde levels and showed a positive influence on oxidative, metabolic, and endocrine disorders in PCOS patients.
population_specificity: Patients with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of vitamin D supplementation on metabolic parameters in patients with obesity or type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: Vitamin D supplementation had no significant effect on most metabolic parameters, though subgroup analyses showed modest reductions in fasting blood glucose, glycated hemoglobin (at ≤2000 IU/day), and diastolic blood pressure (in vitamin D-deficient participants). The overall evidence quality was low to moderate.
population_specificity: Patients with obesity or type 2 diabetes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate vitamin D levels in chronic pancreatitis patients and assess the effectiveness of supplementation therapy in correcting these levels.
results_summary: Vitamin D levels were significantly reduced in chronic pancreatitis patients compared to controls. Supplementation with vitamin D3 successfully adjusted levels to match those of the control group.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic pancreatitis (n=50) and a control group without gastrointestinal diseases (n=20).
effective_dosage: 1,500,000 IU of vitamin D3 per day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of a WeChat-based intervention on parental awareness of vitamin D supplementation for infants under 6 months.
results_summary: The intervention group showed a higher awareness rate of vitamin D supplementation (76.7% vs. 70.5%) compared to the control group, with a statistically significant risk ratio (RR 1.39, 95% CI 1.06-1.82). No significant effects were detected for other health outcomes related to vitamin D.
population_specificity: Primary caregivers of children aged 0-3 years in Minhang District, Shanghai, China.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess serum 25(OH)D3 levels in extrapulmonary tuberculosis (EPTB) patients and evaluate the effect of vitamin D3 supplementation on their treatment outcomes.
results_summary: Vitamin D deficiency was prevalent in all EPTB patients. Supplementation led to significant improvements in weight gain, serum albumin, hemoglobin levels, and reduced inflammatory markers, as well as faster resolution of pleural fluid in TB pleurisy cases.
population_specificity: Newly diagnosed extrapulmonary tuberculosis (EPTB) patients.
effective_dosage: 50,000 IU once a week for 6 weeks (total 300,000 IU), followed by 1000 IU daily.
study_duration: 6 weeks of high-dose supplementation, followed by maintenance doses during anti-TB treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential roles of vitamin D deficiency and inflammation in the development of osteosarcopenia and impaired bone quality in COPD patients.
results_summary: The study suggests that vitamin D deficiency and inflammation, common in COPD patients, may contribute to osteosarcopenia and poor bone quality, leading to fractures. However, specific treatment for COPD-associated osteoporosis remains unestablished.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the association between Vitamin D (25OHD) levels and blood pressure in children with chronic kidney disease.
results_summary: Lower baseline Vitamin D levels were associated with higher clinic systolic blood pressure, but no significant associations were found for diastolic blood pressure or ambulatory blood pressure indices. Longitudinal changes in Vitamin D did not significantly affect blood pressure.
population_specificity: Children with chronic kidney disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of vitamin D3 supplementation on seizure frequency and quality of life in patients with drug-resistant epilepsy.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in seizure frequency reduction after 3 months of blinded treatment, but long-term supplementation (12 months) showed a 30% median reduction in seizures, improved fatigue, and quality of life. Bilateral tonic-clonic seizures were reduced by 52%.
population_specificity: Patients aged ≥15 years with drug-resistant focal or generalized epilepsy and vitamin D deficiency (25(OH)D <30 ng/mL).
effective_dosage: 100,000 IU of vitamin D3 (five doses in 3 months, then 100,000 IU/month for 6 months).
study_duration: 12 months (3-month blinded period, followed by 9-month open-label period).

study_goal: The abstract does not specify a research goal regarding Vitamin D.
results_summary: The abstract does not report any results regarding Vitamin D's effects.
population_specificity: Not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the optimization of vitamin D synthesis, physicochemical properties, and delivery systems, as well as the potential of biotechnological techniques to develop improved vitamin D derivatives for therapeutic use.
results_summary: The study highlights the potential of modified vitamin D derivatives to improve absorption, stability, and targeted physiological effects while minimizing side effects like hypercalcemia. It also emphasizes the role of microbial bioconversions in producing safer and more efficient forms of vitamin D.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on vitamin D deficiency and impaired metabolism)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify genetic predispositions to keloid scarring, including potential associations with the vitamin D receptor (VDR).
results_summary: The study found that polymorphisms in the VDR gene were implicated in keloidogenesis across diverse populations, suggesting a potential genetic link. However, no specific efficacy or clinical outcomes related to vitamin D supplementation were reported.
population_specificity: Diverse ethnic groups with keloid disorder.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine vitamin D metabolism and its correlation with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), as well as the potential role of vitamin D and VDR in diabetic kidney disease (DKD).
results_summary: The study found an association between vitamin D deficiency and the progression of T2DM, with altered VDR signaling in podocytes linked to DKD. Emerging evidence suggests vitamin D may play a role in mitigating kidney diseases associated with T2DM.
population_specificity: Patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus, particularly those with or at risk of diabetic kidney disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of vitamin D deficiency on increased morbidities and chronic conditions in postmenopausal women.
results_summary: The study found that postmenopausal women with vitamin D deficiencies are more vulnerable to comorbidities such as cardiovascular events, metabolic diseases, osteoporosis, and neurodegenerative diseases. Maintaining optimal serum levels of vitamin D is essential for reducing these risks.
population_specificity: Postmenopausal women

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanisms by which Vitamin D receptor (VDR) mediates the link between obesity and cancer proliferation.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that Vitamin D may play a role in cancer development in the context of obesity, but specific findings are not detailed. Several studies indicate a connection, but the abstract lacks conclusive results.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely obese individuals and cancer-related contexts).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of two vitamin D supplementation regimens (400 IU/day vs. 800 IU/day) on serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D3 levels and respiratory outcomes in extremely preterm infants.
results_summary: The study hypothesizes that higher and early vitamin D supplementation (800 IU/day) will significantly increase serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D3 levels at 1 month and reduce respiratory support needs at 36 weeks' postmenstrual age compared to routine supplementation (400 IU/day). Long-term neurodevelopmental outcomes will also be assessed at 22-26 months' corrected age.
population_specificity: Extremely preterm infants (<28 weeks gestation or <1000 g birth weight).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the connection between vitamin D3 and various ocular diseases by analyzing existing studies.
results_summary: The study found suggestive evidence linking vitamin D3 to ocular health, highlighting its immunomodulatory, anti-inflammatory, antioxidant, and angiogenic properties, but noted the need for more robust research to establish causation.
population_specificity: Not specified (analysis of 84 studies, likely diverse populations)

study_goal: To evaluate how treatment with calcifediol and/or corticosteroids modified ICU admission, death, or poor prognosis in hospitalized COVID-19 patients.
results_summary: The study suggests calcifediol may reduce COVID-19 severity, potentially making it the preferred treatment for mild/moderate cases before hyperinflammation occurs. Corticosteroids were also evaluated, but calcifediol showed promise in improving outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients hospitalized with COVID-19 at the Pneumology Unit of the Hospital Universitario Reina Sofía (Córdoba, Spain).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effect of vitamin D supplementation on depression scores among rural adolescents.
results_summary: The study found that vitamin D supplementation led to a statistically significant reduction in Beck depression scores, suggesting its potential benefit for mental health. No significant adverse effects were reported during the trial.
population_specificity: Rural adolescents from Kolar, primarily aged 15 years.
effective_dosage: 2250 IU (intervention arm) and 250 IU (control arm) for 9 weeks.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the relationship between VDR single-nucleotide polymorphisms and the risk of developing lung cancer.
results_summary: The review found associations between certain VDR gene polymorphisms and an increased risk of lung cancer, though the data on VDR polymorphism's role in lung cancer remains conflicting.
population_specificity: Humans, with a focus on genetic variations in the VDR gene across different populations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze three key aspects of pancreas involvement in primary hyperparathyroidism (PHP), including hypercalcemia-induced pancreatitis, MEN1-related neuroendocrine tumors, and insulin resistance.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific findings related to Vitamin D.
population_specificity: Patients with primary hyperparathyroidism (PHP).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether vitamin D could reduce fertility complications caused by chemotherapy in young women with breast cancer.
results_summary: The study found a minimal, non-significant rise in AMH levels in the vitamin D group compared to controls, but no protective effect on ovarian reserve was demonstrated. The difference between groups was not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Young women with breast cancer undergoing chemotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore how RAS-blockade, including potential interactions with vitamin D-receptor upregulation, may influence aging regulatory pathways and mitochondrial function.
results_summary: The study proposed that RAS-blockers, through pathways including vitamin D-receptor upregulation, may mitigate mitochondrial dysfunction and aging effects, but no direct evidence on Vitamin D's role was provided.
population_specificity: Not specified (discussed in the context of mammalian species and potential clinical trials).

study_goal: To determine whether high-dose vitamin D supplementation reduces melanoma relapse in patients with curatively resected cutaneous melanoma.
results_summary: Vitamin D supplementation safely increased serum levels but did not improve relapse-free survival, melanoma-related mortality, or overall survival compared to placebo. No major adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: 436 patients with resected cutaneous melanoma (stages IA to III), mean age 55 years, 54% female.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the health-related quality of life (HRQoL) in pediatric XLH patients treated with burosumab versus conventional therapy (phosphate supplements and active vitamin D).
results_summary: HRQoL was average or slightly above average in burosumab-treated patients, with improvements in physical health, social acceptance, and reduced stress and fatigue compared to conventional therapy. Patients generally rated their HRQoL higher than their caregivers.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients (median age 13.2 years) with X-linked hypophosphatemia (XLH) in Germany.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential roles of vitamin D in COVID-19 outcomes and assess whether supplementation should be recommended.
results_summary: The study found that the impact of vitamin D on COVID-19 outcomes is inconclusive, with mixed results across investigations. The review suggests that vitamin D supplementation should be recommended cautiously.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of COVID-19 patients and vitamin D research).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether low preoperative vitamin D levels (<30 ng/mL) were associated with increased postoperative complications in osteoporotic hip fracture patients.
results_summary: The study found that 70.7% of patients had low vitamin D levels (<30 ng/mL), and logistic regression identified low vitamin D as an independent risk factor for early postoperative complications (OR 2.06). Most complications occurred in the short term (30.2%), with late complications being less frequent (6.7%).
population_specificity: Osteoporotic hip fracture patients undergoing surgery.
effective_dosage: Not specified (measured preoperative serum levels, not administered).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the pathology and management of CKD-MBD, including the role of Vitamin D in addressing bone and mineral disorders in CKD patients.
results_summary: The study highlights that managing abnormal Vitamin D levels is crucial in CKD-MBD treatment, alongside addressing hyperphosphatemia, hypocalcemia, and PTH abnormalities, but does not provide specific efficacy data for Vitamin D alone.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD) and associated mineral and bone disorders (CKD-MBD).

study_goal: The researchers were describing the metabolic pathway of Vitamin D in the human body.
results_summary: The abstract mentions that Vitamin D is hydroxylated in the liver to form calcifediol (25(OH)D) and then further converted to 1,25(OH). No specific study results are provided.
population_specificity: Not specified

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the importance of adequate Vitamin D intake for maintaining bone health and preventing complications like osteoporosis/osteopenia in MEN1 patients.
results_summary: The study emphasized that Vitamin D, along with calcium, magnesium, and phosphate, is crucial for bone health in MEN1 patients, helping to prevent osteoporosis/osteopenia and reduce hypercalciuria-related kidney stone risk.
population_specificity: Patients with Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia Type 1 (MEN1).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize recent literature on associations between sugar intake and diet quality in generally healthy populations aged 2 years or older.
results_summary: The abstract does not mention any findings related to Vitamin D.
population_specificity: Generally healthy populations aged 2 years or older.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining Vitamin D with testosterone, calcium, protein, and progressive resistance training could improve mobility, muscle strength, and quality of life in elderly men with low testosterone.
results_summary: The combination of Vitamin D with other interventions significantly improved 30-s chair stand test performance, reduced tiredness and leg fat, and increased quality of life and RR interval variability without significant adverse effects.
population_specificity: Men aged ≥70 years with low-normal to low testosterone and mobility problems.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current and investigational treatments for secondary hyperparathyroidism (SHPT) in chronic kidney disease (CKD), including the role of vitamin D analogues.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that vitamin D analogues are part of current SHPT therapies but notes inherent limitations, with ongoing research exploring new drugs to improve efficacy and reduce side effects.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic kidney disease (CKD) and secondary hyperparathyroidism (SHPT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if prenatal vitamin D supplementation improves gestational cardiovascular health, particularly in women with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) or obesity.
results_summary: Vitamin D supplementation (1600 IU/d) improved HDL-C levels and reduced hs-CRP levels compared to the control group (400 IU/d). Subgroup analysis showed greater benefits in women with GDM or obesity, including improved lipid profiles, inflammatory markers, and blood pressure.
population_specificity: Pregnant women with serum 25(OH)D < 75 nmol/L, including subgroups with GDM or obesity.
